Merge PDF files to a single PDF

Parameters:

  • dst_dir (str) – path to destination folder

  • output_filename (str) – name of output file (without extension)

Returns:

export_image(output_file=None, dpi=300, drawing_id=None, to_jpg=False, remove_png=True, layers2hide=None, layers2show=None)[source]

Export the current drawing as an image file, optionally adjusting layers and format.

Parameters:

  • output_file (str, optional) – Path to save the exported image. Defaults to None, using Inkscape’s default output.

  • dpi (int, optional) – Resolution of the exported image in dots per inch (DPI). Defaults to 300.

  • drawing_id (str, optional) – Specific drawing ID to export. Defaults to None, exporting the full drawing.

  • to_jpg (bool, optional) – Whether to convert the exported PNG to JPG format. Defaults to False.

  • layers2hide (list[str], optional) – List of layer labels to hide before export. Defaults to None.

  • layers2show (list[str], optional) – List of layer labels to show before export. Defaults to None.

Returns:

Path to the exported image file.

Return type:

str

to_latex(folder=None, filename=None, position='h!', fontsize='scriptsize', fontfamily='sffamily', wfactor=0.95)[source]

Generates a LaTeX figure environment containing an image and its corresponding caption, and saves it as a .tex file if folder and filename is provided.

Parameters:

  • folder (str, optional) – The directory where the LaTeX file will be saved.

  • filename (str, optional) – The name of the LaTeX file (without extension).

  • position (str, optional) – The positioning argument for the LaTeX figure environment (e.g., “h!”, “t”, “b”).

  • fontsize (str, optional) – The font size command to be used (e.g., “scriptsize”, “footnotesize”).

  • fontfamily (str, optional) – The font family command to be used (e.g., “sffamily”, “rmfamily”).

  • wfactor (float, optional) – The width factor for scaling the included image relative to text width.

Returns:

A list of strings representing the lines of the generated LaTeX figure environment.

Return type:

list[str]

to_latex_report(template_file, folder=None, filename=None)[source]

Generates a LaTeX report based on a template file, replacing placeholders with instance attributes and optionally saving the output to a .tex file.

Parameters:

  • template_file (str) – Path to the LaTeX template file containing placeholders.

  • folder (str, optional) – Directory where the output LaTeX file should be saved (optional).

  • filename (str, optional) – Name of the output LaTeX file (without extension) (optional).

Returns:

A list of strings representing the lines of the generated LaTeX report.

Return type:

list[str]

static reset_image(input_path, output_path, scale_factor, dpi)[source]

Scale an image by a given factor while preserving its aspect ratio and setting the DPI.

Parameters:

  • input_path (str) – Path to the input JPG image.

  • output_path (str) – Path to save the output JPG image.

  • scale_factor (float) – Scaling factor (e.g., 2.0 doubles the size, 0.5 reduces by half).

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

Format a glossary entry

Parameters:

  • gls_alias (str) – entry alias (key)

  • gls_descr (str) – entry description (if None, a blind text is iserted)

  • gls_file (str) – path to glossary tex file

  • inplace (bool) – option for overwrite the source file

static to_latex(df, caption=None, caption_lot=None, label=None, filename=None, folder=None)[source]

Convert a DataFrame to a LaTeX table and save it as a .tex file in the specified folder.

Parameters:

  • df (pandas.DataFrame) – DataFrame to be converted to LaTeX format.

  • filename (str) – The name of the file to save the LaTeX table as (without the extension).

  • folder (str) – The path to the folder where the .tex file will be saved.

  • caption (Optional[str]) – The caption for the table. Defaults to a placeholder caption if None.

  • caption_lot (Optional[str]) – The List of Tables caption. Defaults to a placeholder caption if None.

  • label (Optional[str]) – The LaTeX label to be used for referencing the table. Defaults to ‘tab:label’ if None.

Returns:

None

Return type:

None
